did.abstract: Transcript of a speech given by an unidentified Brooklyn municipal representative regarding the presentation of a musket to a soldier in an unidentified company of light infantry. The speech implies that the soldier had fought in the Revolutionary War.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1977.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single document.

prefercite.p: Military ceremony speech transcript, circa 1800, 1977.608, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Transcript of a speech given by an unidentified Brooklyn municipal representative regarding the presentation of a musket to a soldier in an unidentified company of light infantry. The speech implies that the soldier had fought in the Revolutionary War. It is undated, but is presumed to date from circa 1800.
